Security policy prevents use of Samsung DeX.
The security policy prevents the use of Wi-Fi data, mobile data, and tethering in DeX. A wired connection is required for network features.
Due to security policy, disconnect external display to exit Samsung DeX.

"A software problem was detected during startup. Check for a system software update, which may resolve this issue. If there's no software update and this problem keeps happening, contact Customer Support."
Security policy prevents the use of Mobile Hotspot.
The Knox security policy restricts this action.
Network traffic may be monitored by the VPN or proxy configured by your device administrator.
Browser closed due to updated settings. Reopen your browser.
Too many files have been created on your phone. Apps may stop working correctly and your phone may no longer start up. Back up any important data and factory reset your phone.
Back up data to a USB storage device. Restore later on this device or another device using Smart Switch.
"Only preinstalled apps are available. Personal data, including pictures, messages, and accounts, can't be accessed, and downloaded apps are hidden."
Everything will go back to the way it was when Maintenance mode was first turned on.
"You'll need to unlock your phone to turn off Maintenance mode."
"You'll need to unlock your tablet to turn off Maintenance mode."
Nothing will be saved that happens while Maintenance mode is on, such as downloaded data, app installations, or settings changes.
Your phone needs to restart to turn on Maintenance mode.
Your tablet needs to restart to turn on Maintenance mode.

"To help our support staff analyze any problems with your phone, we recommend creating a system log before starting Maintenance mode.
The log shows which apps were used and any errors that may have occurred recently, but doesn't include any other personal information. The log will only be used to analyze problems and not for any other purpose. It normally takes around 2 minutes to create the log."

"To help our support staff analyze any problems with your tablet, we recommend creating a system log before starting Maintenance mode.
The log shows which apps were used and any errors that may have occurred recently, but doesn't include any other personal information. The log will only be used to analyze problems and not for any other purpose. It normally takes around 2 minutes to create the log."

"Your phone's internal storage is almost completely full. If you run out of storage space, some apps and features might stop working correctly. Try deleting some files or apps you don't need anymore. After deleting, don't forget to empty the Trash."

"Your tablet's internal storage is almost completely full. If you run out of storage space, some apps and features might stop working correctly. Try deleting some files or apps you don't need anymore. After deleting, don't forget to empty the Trash."
Backing up your data is recommended just in case data is lost while your phone is being repaired.
Backing up your data is recommended just in case data is lost while your tablet is being repaired.
How Maintenance mode keeps you safe
What happens when you turn off Maintenance mode
"Maintenance mode protects your privacy while someone else is using your phone, such as when you're sending it for repairs."
"Maintenance mode protects your privacy while someone else is using your tablet, such as when you're sending it for repairs."
Your phone is in Maintenance mode
Your tablet is in Maintenance mode
Your phone needs to restart to exit Maintenance mode.
Your tablet needs to restart to exit Maintenance mode.

"You'll need to unlock your phone to turn off Maintenance mode. When you do, everything will go back to the way it was when Maintenance mode was first turned on. Changes made while Maintenance mode is on, such as downloaded data, installed apps, or settings changes, aren't saved."

"You'll need to unlock your tablet to turn off Maintenance mode. When you do, everything will go back to the way it was when Maintenance mode was first turned on. Changes made while Maintenance mode is on, such as downloaded data, installed apps, or settings changes, aren't saved."
Stop backing up your data and turn on Maintenance mode?
To turn on Maintenance mode, you need to finish or delete your incomplete backup.
To turn on Maintenance mode, you need to stop your ongoing backup.
To turn on Maintenance mode, you need to stop restoring your backup data.
This normally takes around 2 minutes. After the log is created, your phone will restart in Maintenance mode and you can safely hand over your phone for maintenance.
This normally takes around 2 minutes. After the log is created, your tablet will restart in Maintenance mode and you can safely hand over your tablet for maintenance.

"Switching to maintenance mode…
Your phone will restart soon."

"Switching to maintenance mode…
Your tablet will restart soon."

The audio device you selected for this app is the same as the current audio output device for your phone. To separate the sound for this app, change your audio output device in the quick settings panel.
The audio device you selected for %1$s (%2$s) is the same as your main audio device. Change your main audio device to %3$s to separate sound for this app.
The audio device you selected to separate sound for certain apps (%1$s) is the same as your main audio device. Change your main audio device to %2$s to separate sound for these apps.

Moisture has been detected in your charger/USB port. To remove the moisture, follow the tips below.
Shake your phone to remove moisture from the port.
It may take several hours for moisture in the port to dry.
You can speed up drying by pointing a fan or dryer (cool air only) toward the port.

"We've detected moisture or foreign material in your charging/USB port.
Check your charging/USB port for any foreign material such as dust or debris. To prevent damage to your phone, don't plug anything in until the charging port is clean and the moisture is gone.
To dry the port, shake out any moisture, then wait for it to dry, which could take several hours. You can speed up drying by pointing a fan or dryer (cool air only) at the port."

"We've detected moisture or foreign material in your charging/USB port.
Check your charging/USB port for any foreign material such as dust or debris. To prevent damage to your phone, don't plug anything in until the charging port is clean and the moisture is gone.
To dry the port, shake out any moisture, then wait for it to dry, which could take several hours. You can speed up drying by pointing a fan or dryer (cool air only) at the port.
In the meantime, you can charge your phone wirelessly."
"There's moisture or foreign material in your charging/USB port. Check before charging."
"Moisture has been detected in your charger/USB port. Make sure it's dry before charging your phone. It may take some time to dry completely."
